intro: Psychotria setistipula, commonly known as the red-tipped psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a distinctive red tip, and its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Psychotria setistipula is often found in humid environments and can thrive in partial to full shade. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora and ecological interactions.
